Server header

INFO

Summary

The server header for the remote web server is: "openresty/1.21.4.3". This information was found in the request with id 34.

DNS wildcard

INFO

Summary

The target site has a DNS wildcard configuration, the contents of "http://foobar.localhost/" are equal to the ones of "http://localhost/". This information was found in the requests with ids 32 and 130.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/

HTTP proof

Strange HTTP response code

INFO

Summary

The remote web server sent 2 HTTP responses with the uncommon response status code 405 using "Not Allowed" as message. The first ten URLs which sent the uncommon status code are: - http://localhost/VulnerableApp/XXEVulnerability/LEVEL_4 - http://localhost/axjuu


Description

The server responded with a strange HTTP status code. This is a non-issue however exotic HTTP response status codes can provide useful insights into the behavior of the web application and assist with the information security analysis.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/axjuu

Fix

Manually inspect the HTTP response status code and body

References

  • RFC-2616

HTTP proof

PUT http://localhost/axjuu HTTP/1.1
User-agent: w4af.net
Content-type: text/plain
Accept-encoding: gzip, deflate
Content-length: 6
Host: localhost
Accept: */*

FDln0x
b'HTTP/1.1 405 Not Allowed\r\nServer: openresty/1.21.4.3\r\nDate: Wed, 20 Mar 2024 19:23:41 GMT\r\nContent-Type: text/html\r\nContent-Length: 163\r\nConnection: keep-alive\r\n'
b'<html>\r\n<head><title>405 Not Allowed</title></head>\r\n<body>\r\n<center><h1>405 Not Allowed</h1></center>\r\n<hr><center>openresty/1.21.4.3</center>\r\n</body>\r\n</html>\r\n'
GET http://localhost/VulnerableApp/XXEVulnerability/LEVEL_4 HTTP/1.1
User-agent: python-requests/2.31.0
Host: localhost
Accept-encoding: gzip, deflate
Accept: */*
Connection: keep-alive
Content-type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Content-length: 0
b'HTTP/1.1 405 \r\nServer: openresty/1.21.4.3\r\nDate: Wed, 20 Mar 2024 19:24:01 GMT\r\nContent-Length: 0\r\nConnection: keep-alive\r\nAllow: POST\r\n'
b''

Internal hostname in HTML link

INFO

Summary

The content of "http://localhost/" references a non existent domain: "localhost". This can be a broken link, or an internal domain name. This information was found in the request with id 283.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/

Operating system

INFO

Summary

Fingerprinted this host as a *nix system. Detection for this operating system is weak, "if not windows then linux". This information was found in the requests with ids 407 and 413.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/static\main.82e39d93.chunk.css

HTTP proof

GET http://localhost/static%5Cmain.82e39d93.chunk.css HTTP/1.1
User-agent: w4af.net
Accept-encoding: gzip, deflate

Blank http response body

INFO

Summary

The URL: "http://localhost/static/css/2.6d022045.chunk.css" returned an empty body, this could indicate an application error. This information was found in the request with id 408.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/static/css/2.6d022045.chunk.css

HTTP proof

GET http://localhost/static/css/2.6d022045.chunk.css HTTP/1.1
User-agent: w4af.net
Accept-encoding: gzip, deflate
Host: localhost
Accept: */*
b'HTTP/1.1 200 OK\r\nServer: openresty/1.21.4.3\r\nDate: Wed, 20 Mar 2024 19:23:42 GMT\r\nContent-Type: text/css\r\nContent-Length: 844160\r\nLast-Modified: Sun, 03 Dec 2023 20:44:36 GMT\r\nConnection: keep-alive\r\nETag: "656ce8b4-ce180"\r\nAccept-Ranges: bytes\r\n'
b''

Allowed HTTP methods

INFO

Summary

The URL "http://localhost/" has the following enabled HTTP methods: *, GET, HEAD. This information was found in the requests with ids 63, 329, 467 and 590.


Description

There are a number of HTTP methods that can be used on a webserver (OPTIONS, HEAD, GET, POST, PUT, DELETE etc.). Each of these methods perform a different function and each have an associated level of risk when their use is permitted on the webserver.

A client can use the OPTIONS method within a request to query a server to determine which methods are allowed.

Cyber-criminals will almost always perform this simple test as it will give a very quick indication of any high-risk methods being permitted by the server. The tool discovered that several methods are supported by the server.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/

Fix

It is recommended that a whitelisting approach be taken to explicitly permit the HTTP methods required by the application and block all others.

Typically the only HTTP methods required for most applications are GET and POST. All other methods perform actions that are rarely required or perform actions that are inherently risky. These risky methods (such as PUT, DELETE, etc) should be protected by strict limitations, such as ensuring that the channel is secure (SSL/TLS enabled) and only authorised and trusted clients are permitted to use them.

References

  • Apache.org

Allowed HTTP methods

INFO

Summary

The URL "http://localhost/static/css/" has the following enabled HTTP methods: *. This information was found in the requests with ids 360 and 576.


Description

There are a number of HTTP methods that can be used on a webserver (OPTIONS, HEAD, GET, POST, PUT, DELETE etc.). Each of these methods perform a different function and each have an associated level of risk when their use is permitted on the webserver.

A client can use the OPTIONS method within a request to query a server to determine which methods are allowed.

Cyber-criminals will almost always perform this simple test as it will give a very quick indication of any high-risk methods being permitted by the server. The tool discovered that several methods are supported by the server.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/static/css/

Fix

It is recommended that a whitelisting approach be taken to explicitly permit the HTTP methods required by the application and block all others.

Typically the only HTTP methods required for most applications are GET and POST. All other methods perform actions that are rarely required or perform actions that are inherently risky. These risky methods (such as PUT, DELETE, etc) should be protected by strict limitations, such as ensuring that the channel is secure (SSL/TLS enabled) and only authorised and trusted clients are permitted to use them.

References

  • Apache.org

HTTP proof

OPTIONS http://localhost/static/css/ HTTP/1.1
User-agent: w4af.net
Accept-encoding: gzip, deflate
Host: localhost
Accept: */*
b'HTTP/1.1 405 Not Allowed\r\nServer: openresty/1.21.4.3\r\nDate: Wed, 20 Mar 2024 19:23:42 GMT\r\nContent-Type: text/html\r\nContent-Length: 163\r\nConnection: keep-alive\r\n'
b'<html>\r\n<head><title>405 Not Allowed</title></head>\r\n<body>\r\n<center><h1>405 Not Allowed</h1></center>\r\n<hr><center>openresty/1.21.4.3</center>\r\n</body>\r\n</html>\r\n'
* http://localhost/static/css/ HTTP/1.1
User-agent: w4af.net
Accept-encoding: gzip, deflate
Host: localhost
Accept: */*
b'HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request\r\nServer: openresty/1.21.4.3\r\nDate: Wed, 20 Mar 2024 19:23:43 GMT\r\nContent-Type: text/html\r\nContent-Length: 163\r\nConnection: close\r\n'
b'<html>\r\n<head><title>400 Bad Request</title></head>\r\n<body>\r\n<center><h1>400 Bad Request</h1></center>\r\n<hr><center>openresty/1.21.4.3</center>\r\n</body>\r\n</html>\r\n'

Allowed HTTP methods

INFO

Summary

The URL "http://localhost/static/js/" has the following enabled HTTP methods: *. This information was found in the requests with ids 440 and 638.


Description

There are a number of HTTP methods that can be used on a webserver (OPTIONS, HEAD, GET, POST, PUT, DELETE etc.). Each of these methods perform a different function and each have an associated level of risk when their use is permitted on the webserver.

A client can use the OPTIONS method within a request to query a server to determine which methods are allowed.

Cyber-criminals will almost always perform this simple test as it will give a very quick indication of any high-risk methods being permitted by the server. The tool discovered that several methods are supported by the server.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/static/js/

Fix

It is recommended that a whitelisting approach be taken to explicitly permit the HTTP methods required by the application and block all others.

Typically the only HTTP methods required for most applications are GET and POST. All other methods perform actions that are rarely required or perform actions that are inherently risky. These risky methods (such as PUT, DELETE, etc) should be protected by strict limitations, such as ensuring that the channel is secure (SSL/TLS enabled) and only authorised and trusted clients are permitted to use them.

  • Apache.org

These risky methods (such as PUT, DELETE, etc) should be protected by strict limitations, such as ensuring that the channel is secure (SSL/TLS enabled) and only authorised and trusted clients are permitted to use them.

Summary

Description

There are a number of HTTP methods that can be used on a webserver (OPTIONS, HEAD, GET, POST, PUT, DELETE etc.). Each of these methods perform a different function and each have an associated level of risk when their use is permitted on the webserver.

A client can use the OPTIONS method within a request to query a server to determine which methods are allowed.

Cyber-criminals will almost always perform this simple test as it will give a very quick indication of any high-risk methods being permitted by the server. The tool discovered that several methods are supported by the server.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/images/

Fix

Typically the only HTTP methods required for most applications are GET and POST. All other methods perform actions that are rarely required or perform actions that are inherently risky. These risky methods (such as PUT, DELETE, etc) should be protected by strict limitations, such as ensuring that the channel is secure (SSL/TLS enabled) and only authorised and trusted clients are permitted to use them.

Strange HTTP Reason message

INFO

Summary

The remote web server sent 30 HTTP responses with the uncommon status message "", manual inspection is recommended. OS commanding vulnerability

HIGH

Summary

OS Commanding was found at: "http://localhost/VulnerableApp/CommandInjection/LEVEL_1", using HTTP method GET. The sent data was: "...ipaddress=b'ZcwKhOPLrexxBbto\n'|/bin/cat /etc/passwd..." The modified parameter was "ipaddress". This vulnerability was found in the request with id 2189.


Description

To perform specific actions from within a web application, it is occasionally required to run Operating System commands and have the output of these commands captured by the web application and returned to the client.

OS command injection occurs when user supplied input is inserted into one of these commands without proper sanitisation and is then executed by the server.

Cyber-criminals will abuse this weakness to perform their own arbitrary commands on the server. This can include everything from simple ping commands to map the internal network, to obtaining full control of the server.

It was possible to inject and verify the execution of specific Operating System commands which indicates that proper input sanitisation is not occurring.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/VulnerableApp/CommandInjection/LEVEL_1
  • Vulnerable Parameter: ipaddress

Fix

It is recommended that untrusted data is never used to form a command to be executed by the OS.

To validate data, the application should ensure that the supplied value contains only the characters that are required to perform the required action.

For example, where the form field expects an IP address, only numbers and periods should be accepted. Additionally, all control operators (&, &&, |, ||, $, \, #) should be explicitly denied and never accepted as valid input by the server.

References

  • WASC
  • OWASP

HTTP proof

GET http://localhost/VulnerableApp/CommandInjection/LEVEL_1?ipaddress=b%27ZcwKhOPLrexxBbto%5Cn%27%7C%2Fbin%2Fcat%20%2Fetc%2Fpasswd HTTP/1.1
User-agent: python-requests/2.31.0
Host: localhost
Accept-encoding: gzip, deflate
Accept: */*
Connection: keep-alive
b'HTTP/1.1 200 \r\nServer: openresty/1.21.4.3\r\nDate: Wed, 20 Mar 2024 19:24:28 GMT\r\nContent-Type: application/json\r\nTransfer-Encoding: chunked\r\nConnection: keep-alive\r\n'
b'{"content":"root:x:0:0:root:/root:/bin/ash\\nbin:x:1:1:bin:/bin:/sbin/nologin\\ndaemon:x:2:2:daemon:/sbin:/sbin/nologin\\nadm:x:3:4:adm:/var/adm:/sbin/nologin\\nlp:x:4:7:lp:/var/spool/lpd:/sbin/nologin\\nsync:x:5:0:sync:/sbin:/bin/sync\\nshutdown:x:6:0:shutdown:/sbin:/sbin/shutdown\\nhalt:x:7:0:halt:/sbin:/sbin/halt\\nmail:x:8:12:mail:/var/spool/mail:/sbin/nologin\\nnews:x:9:13:news:/usr/lib/news:/sbin/nologin\\nuucp:x:10:14:uucp:/var/spool/uucppublic:/sbin/nologin\\noperator:x:11:0:operator:/root:/bin/sh\\nman:x:13:15:man:/usr/man:/sbin/nologin\\npostmaster:x:14:12:postmaster:/var/spool/mail:/sbin/nologin\\ncron:x:16:16:cron:/var/spool/cron:/sbin/nologin\\nftp:x:21:21::/var/lib/ftp:/sbin/nologin\\nsshd:x:22:22:sshd:/dev/null:/sbin/nologin\\nat:x:25:25:at:/var/spool/cron/atjobs:/sbin/nologin\\nsquid:x:31:31:Squid:/var/cache/squid:/sbin/nologin\\nxfs:x:33:33:X Font Server:/etc/X11/fs:/sbin/nologin\\ngames:x:35:35:games:/usr/games:/sbin/nologin\\npostgres:x:70:70::/var/lib/postgresql:/bin/sh\\ncyrus:x:85:12::/usr/cyrus:/sbin/nologin\\nvpopmail:x:89:89::/var/vpopmail:/sbin/nologin\\nntp:x:123:123:NTP:/var/empty:/sbin/nologin\\nsmmsp:x:209:209:smmsp:/var/spool/mqueue:/sbin/nologin\\nguest:x:405:100:guest:/dev/null:/sbin/nologin\\nnobody:x:65534:65534:nobody:/:/sbin/nologin\\nping: bad address \'bZcwKhOPLrexxBbto\\\\n\'\\n","isValid":true}'

DAV methods enabled

INFO

Summary

The URL "http://localhost/VulnerableApp/BlindSQLInjectionVulnerability/" has the following allowed methods. These include DAV methods and should be disabled: *, ACL, BASELINE_CONTROL, CHECKIN, CHECKOUT, COPY, DEBUG, GET, HEAD, INDEX, INVALID, INVOKE, LABEL, LINK, LOCK, MERGE, MKACTIVITY, MKCOL, MKDIR, MKWORKSPACE, MOVE, NOTIFY, OPTIONS, PATCH, PIN, POLL, POST, PROPFIND, PROPPATCH, REPLY, REPORT, RMDIR, SEARCH, SHOWMETHOD, SPACEJUMP, SUBSCRIBE, SUBSCRIPTIONS, TEXTSEARCH, TRACK, UNCHECKOUT, UNLINK, UNLOCK, UNSUBSCRIBE, VERSION_CONTROL. This information was found in the requests with ids 1016, 1068, 1079, 1085, 1095, 1106, 1136, 1206, 1218, 1246, 1253, 1278, 1292, 1315, 1322, 1352, 1356, 1368, 1397, 1433, 1496, 1562, 1599 to 1600, 1680, 1711, 1742, 1746, 1787, 1796, 1847, 1886, 1930, 1977, 2053, 2080, 2091, 2121, 2147, 2176, 2196, 2234, 2265, 2296 and 2316.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/VulnerableApp/BlindSQLInjectionVulnerability/

Allowed HTTP methods

INFO

Summary

The URL "http://localhost/VulnerableApp/" has the following enabled HTTP methods: *, GET, HEAD, OPTIONS. This information was found in the requests with ids 965, 1134, 1681, 2310 and 2318.


Description

There are a number of HTTP methods that can be used on a webserver (OPTIONS, HEAD, GET, POST, PUT, DELETE etc.). Each of these methods perform a different function and each have an associated level of risk when their use is permitted on the webserver.

A client can use the OPTIONS method within a request to query a server to determine which methods are allowed.

Cyber-criminals will almost always perform this simple test as it will give a very quick indication of any high-risk methods being permitted by the server. The tool discovered that several methods are supported by the server.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/VulnerableApp/

Fix

It is recommended that a whitelisting approach be taken to explicitly permit the HTTP methods required by the application and block all others.

Typically the only HTTP methods required for most applications are GET and POST. All other methods perform actions that are rarely required or perform actions that are inherently risky. These risky methods (such as PUT, DELETE, etc) should be protected by strict limitations, such as ensuring that the channel is secure (SSL/TLS enabled) and only authorised and trusted clients are permitted to use them.

References

  • Apache.org

HTTP proof

OPTIONS http://localhost/VulnerableApp/ HTTP/1.1
User-agent: w4af.net
Accept-encoding: gzip, deflate
Host: localhost
Accept: */*

class="chooseMode">\n\t\t\t\t<h2>\n\t\t\t\t\tWelcome Security enthusiast\n\t\t\t\t</h2>\n\t\t\t\tAre you looking to ?\n\t\t\t\t<div>\n\t\t\t\t\t<button id="learnAndPracticeBtn" class="mode-item">Learn Security</button>\n\t\t\t\t\t<button id="testScannerBtn" class="mode-item">Test Scanner</button>\n\t\t\t\t</div>\n\t\t\t</div>\n\t\t\t<div class="description">\n\t\t\t\t<!-- TODO need to write it. -->\n\t\t\t</div>\n\t\t\t<div id="learnAndPractice" class="hide-component">\n\t\t\t\t<div class="chooseVulnerability">\n\t\t\t\t\t<h2>Please choose the vulnerability which you are looking to learn.</h2>\n\t\t\t\t</div>\n\t\t\t\t<div class="col-3 master"></div>\n\t\t\t\t<div>\n\t\t\t\t\t<div id="vulnerabilityDescription"></div>\n\t\t\t\t\t<button id="vulnPracticeBtn" class="mode-item">Practice Vulnerability</button>\n\t\t\t\t\t<div id="vulnPractice" class="hide-component">\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<div class="col-2 inner-master master"></div>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<div class="col-6 text-center"></h1>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<div>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<button id="showHelp">Show Help</button>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<button id="hideHelp" disabled=true>Hide Help</button>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<div id="helpText"></div>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</div>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t</div>\n\t\t\t\t\t</div>\n\t\t\t\t\t<button id="vulnLearnBtn" class="mode-item hide-component">Learn Vulnerability</button>\n\t\t\t\t\t<div id="dynamicScripts">\n\t\t\t\t\t</div>\n\t\t\t\t</div>\n\t\t\t</div>\n\t\t\t<div id="testScanner" class="hide-component">\n\t\t\t\t<h2>How can Vulnerability Scanning Tools use VulnerableApp?</h2>\n\t\t\t\t<hr>\n\t\t\t\t<div>\n\t\t\t\tVulnerableApp is specifically designed for the Vulnerability Scanning Tools like ZAP wherein\n\t\t\t\tfew endpoints are exposed only for helping them.\n\t\t\t\t<br/>\n\t\t\t\t<b>Following are the endpoints exposed: </b>\n\t\t\t\t<ol>\n\t\t\t\t<li><a href="/VulnerableApp/scanner">Scanner Endpoint</a></li>\n\t\t\t\t<li><a href="/VulnerableApp/sitemap.xml">SiteMap Endpoint</a></li>\n\t\t\t\t</ol>\n\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t<b>Scanner Endpoint</b><br/>\n\t\t\t\tScanner is specially crafted endpoint to provide information about each vulnerability present in VulnerableApp.<br/>\n\t\t\t\tFollowing is the Json Response explanation:\n\t\t\t\t<ol>\n\t\t\t\t<li>Url of the vulnerable endpoint</li>\n\t\t\t\t<li>Http method like GET/POST accepted by vulnerable endpoint</li>\n\t\t\t\t<li>Parameter name which represents the input to the endpoint</li>\n\t\t\t\t<li>Type of vulnerabilities exposed by the endpoint</li>\n\t\t\t\t<li>Location of the parameter like Query Param/Header etc.</li>\n\t\t\t\t</ol>\n\t\t\t\tAs Vulnerability Scanning Tools use "sitemap.xml", "robots.txt" etc in order to find the exposed endpoints\n\t\t\t\tso we have provided sitemap which provides all the vulnerable endpoints present in the VulnerableApp.\n\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\tIn case Vulnerability Scanning Tools wants to use VulnerableApp, you need to understand the\n\t\t\t\toutput of Scanner endpoint and only that information alone can suffice for all needs. These tools can also \n\t\t\t\tuse sitemap for the same but that might not suffice for all usecases.\n\t\t\t\t</div>\n\t\t\t</div>\n\t\t\t<script src="vulnerableApp.js"></script>\n\t\t</div>\n\t\t<!-- <div id="contribution">\n\t\t\tFor Contribution to Vulnerable App visit <a href="https://github.com/SasanLabs/VulnerableApp/blob/master/README.md#contributing-to-project">Github</a>\n\t\t</div>\n\t\t<div id="aboutContainer" class="aboutContainer">\n\t\t\t<div>\n\t\t\t\tAs Web Applications are becoming very popular these days, there comes the needs to\n\t\t\t\tsecure them and there are many security vulnerability finding tools but while\n\t\t\t\tdeveloping those tools developers need to test them but there are no or\n\t\t\t\tvery less such extensible vulnerable apps for testing those tools.\n\t\t\t\tThere are deliberately vulnerable applications exists in the market, but they\n\t\t\t\tare not written with such an intent and hence lags extensibility e.g. adding new vulnerablities is quite\n\t\t\t\tdifficult.\n\t\t\t</div>\n\t\t\t<div>\n\t\t\t\tSo generally developer write their own vulnerable applications but that cause productivity loss and\n\t\t\t\talso many times rework is done. This Project VulnerableApp is build keeping these factors in mind so\n\t\t\t\tthis\n\t\t\t\tproject\n\t\t\t\tis scalable, extensible, easier to integrate and easier to learn.\n\t\t\t</div>\n\t\t</div> -->\n\t</div>\n</body>\n\n</html>'

DAV methods enabled

INFO

Summary

The URL "http://localhost/VulnerableApp/CommandInjection/" has the following allowed methods. These include DAV methods and should be disabled: *, ACL, BASELINE_CONTROL, CHECKIN, CHECKOUT, COPY, DEBUG, GET, HEAD, INDEX, INVALID, INVOKE, LABEL, LINK, LOCK, MERGE, MKACTIVITY, MKCOL, MKDIR, MKWORKSPACE, MOVE, NOTIFY, OPTIONS, PATCH, PIN, POLL, POST, PROPFIND, PROPPATCH, REPLY, REPORT, RMDIR, SEARCH, SHOWMETHOD, SPACEJUMP, SUBSCRIBE, SUBSCRIPTIONS, TEXTSEARCH, TRACK, UNCHECKOUT, UNLINK, UNLOCK, UNSUBSCRIBE, VERSION_CONTROL. This information was found in the requests with ids 1075, 1093, 1104, 1137, 1212, 1238, 1248, 1268, 1287, 1334, 1349, 1355, 1365, 1379, 1402, 1468, 1540, 1566, 1606, 1619, 1637, 1679, 1705, 1731, 1788, 1794, 1833, 1840, 1849, 1895, 1932, 1975, 2019, 2057, 2078, 2125, 2153, 2174, 2201, 2209, 2214, 2258, 2302, 2335 and 2376.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/VulnerableApp/CommandInjection/

HTTP proof

OPTIONS http://localhost/VulnerableApp/CommandInjection/ HTTP/1.1

Accept-encoding: gzip, deflate

b'{"timestamp":"2024-03-20T19:24:31.499+00:00","status":404,"error":"Not Found","message":"","path":"/VulnerableApp/CommandInjection/"}'

SQL injection

HIGH

Summary

SQL injection in a Unknown database was found at: "http://localhost/VulnerableApp/CommandInjection/LEVEL_1", using HTTP method GET. The sent data was: "ipaddress=a%27b%22c%27d%22" The modified parameter was "ipaddress". This vulnerability was found in the request with id 2464.


Description

Due to the requirement for dynamic content of today's web applications, many rely on a database backend to store data that will be called upon and processed by the web application (or other programs). Web applications retrieve data from the database by using Structured Query Language (SQL) queries.

To meet demands of many developers, database servers (such as MSSQL, MySQL, Oracle etc.) have additional built-in functionality that can allow extensive control of the database and interaction with the host operating system itself. An SQL injection occurs when a value originating from the client's request is used within a SQL query without prior sanitisation. This could allow cyber-criminals to execute arbitrary SQL code and steal data or use the additional functionality of the database server to take control of more server components.

The successful exploitation of a SQL injection can be devastating to an organisation and is one of the most commonly exploited web application vulnerabilities.

This injection was detected as the tool was able to cause the server to respond to the request with a database related error.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/VulnerableApp/CommandInjection/LEVEL_1
  • Vulnerable Parameter: ipaddress

Fix

The only proven method to prevent against SQL injection attacks while still maintaining full application functionality is to use parameterized queries (also known as prepared statements). When utilising this method of querying the database, any value supplied by the client will be handled as a string value rather than part of the SQL query.

Additionally, when utilising parameterized queries, the database engine will automatically check to make sure the string being used matches that of the column. For example, the database engine will check that the user supplied input is an integer if the database column is configured to contain integers.

References

  • SecuriTeam
  • Wikipedia
  • OWASP
  • WASC
  • W3 Schools
  • UnixWiz

HTTP proof

GET http://localhost/VulnerableApp/CommandInjection/LEVEL_1?ipaddress=a%27b%22c%27d%22 HTTP/1.1
User-agent: python-requests/2.31.0
Host: localhost
Accept-encoding: gzip, deflate
Accept: */*
Connection: keep-alive
b'HTTP/1.1 200 \r\nServer: openresty/1.21.4.3\r\nDate: Wed, 20 Mar 2024 19:24:33 GMT\r\nContent-Type: application/json\r\nTransfer-Encoding: chunked\r\nConnection: keep-alive\r\n'
b'{"content":"sh: syntax error: unterminated quoted string\\n","isValid":true}'

DAV methods enabled

INFO

Summary

The URL "http://localhost/VulnerableApp/ErrorBasedSQLInjectionVulnerability/" has the following allowed methods. These include DAV methods and should be disabled: *, ACL, BASELINE_CONTROL, CHECKIN, CHECKOUT, COPY, DEBUG, GET, HEAD, INDEX, INVALID, INVOKE, LABEL, LINK, LOCK, MERGE, MKACTIVITY, MKCOL, MKDIR, MKWORKSPACE, MOVE, NOTIFY, OPTIONS, PATCH, PIN, POLL, POST, PROPFIND, PROPPATCH, REPLY, REPORT, RMDIR, SEARCH, SHOWMETHOD, SPACEJUMP, SUBSCRIBE, SUBSCRIPTIONS, TEXTSEARCH, TRACK, UNCHECKOUT, UNLINK, UNLOCK, UNSUBSCRIBE, VERSION_CONTROL. This information was found in the requests with ids 1364, 1463, 1487, 1510, 1556, 1569, 1590, 1629, 1648, 1682, 1703, 1729, 1754, 1792, 1799, 1843, 1885, 1897, 1935, 1978, 1999, 2054, 2090, 2117, 2146, 2166, 2179, 2182, 2260, 2270, 2306, 2334, 2361, 2368, 2380, 2397, 2409, 2435, 2454, 2476, 2503, 2528, 2541, 2554 and 2596.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/VulnerableApp/ErrorBasedSQLInjectionVulnerability/

DAV methods enabled

INFO

Summary

The URL "http://localhost/VulnerableApp/Http3xxStatusCodeBasedInjection/" has the following allowed methods. These include DAV methods and should be disabled: *, ACL, BASELINE_CONTROL, CHECKIN, CHECKOUT, COPY, DEBUG, GET, HEAD, INDEX, INVALID, INVOKE, LABEL, LINK, LOCK, MERGE, MKACTIVITY, MKCOL, MKDIR, MKWORKSPACE, MOVE, NOTIFY, OPTIONS, PATCH, PIN, POLL, POST, PROPFIND, PROPPATCH, REPLY, REPORT, RMDIR, SEARCH, SHOWMETHOD, SPACEJUMP, SUBSCRIBE, SUBSCRIPTIONS, TEXTSEARCH, TRACK, UNCHECKOUT, UNLINK, UNLOCK, UNSUBSCRIBE, VERSION_CONTROL. This information was found in the requests with ids 1517, 1587, 1593, 1627, 1636, 1645, 1666, 1689, 1709, 1747, 1785, 1797, 1881, 1887, 1928, 1986, 1998, 2021, 2051, 2089, 2129, 2133, 2167, 2177, 2197, 2228, 2268, 2308, 2343, 2364, 2374, 2387, 2404 to 2405, 2420, 2462, 2487, 2520, 2529, 2560, 2591, 2606, 2612, 2618 and 2638.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/VulnerableApp/Http3xxStatusCodeBasedInjection/

b'{"timestamp":"2024-03-20T19:24:37.564+00:00","status":404,"error":"Not Found","message":"","path":"/VulnerableApp/Http3xxStatusCodeBasedInjection/"}'

OS commanding vulnerability

HIGH

Summary

OS Commanding was found at: "http://localhost/VulnerableApp/CommandInjection/LEVEL_2", using HTTP method GET. The sent data was: "ipaddress=%3B%2Fbin%2Fcat%20%2Fetc%2Fpasswd" The modified parameter was "ipaddress". This vulnerability was found in the request with id 2696.


Description

To perform specific actions from within a web application, it is occasionally required to run Operating System commands and have the output of these commands captured by the web application and returned to the client.

OS command injection occurs when user supplied input is inserted into one of these commands without proper sanitisation and is then executed by the server.

Cyber-criminals will abuse this weakness to perform their own arbitrary commands on the server. This can include everything from simple ping commands to map the internal network, to obtaining full control of the server.

It was possible to inject and verify the execution of specific Operating System commands which indicates that proper input sanitisation is not occurring.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/VulnerableApp/CommandInjection/LEVEL_2
  • Vulnerable Parameter: ipaddress

Fix

It is recommended that untrusted data is never used to form a command to be executed by the OS.

To validate data, the application should ensure that the supplied value contains only the characters that are required to perform the required action.

For example, where the form field expects an IP address, only numbers and periods should be accepted. Additionally, all control operators (&, &&, |, ||, $, \, #) should be explicitly denied and never accepted as valid input by the server.

References

  • WASC
  • OWASP

HTTP proof

GET http://localhost/VulnerableApp/CommandInjection/LEVEL_2?ipaddress=%3B%2Fbin%2Fcat%20%2Fetc%2Fpasswd HTTP/1.1
User-agent: python-requests/2.31.0
Host: localhost
Accept-encoding: gzip, deflate
Accept: */*
Connection: keep-alive
b'HTTP/1.1 200 \r\nServer: openresty/1.21.4.3\r\nDate: Wed, 20 Mar 2024 19:24:39 GMT\r\nContent-Type: application/json\r\nTransfer-Encoding: chunked\r\nConnection: keep-alive\r\n'
b'{"content":"BusyBox v1.29.3 (2019-01-24 07:45:07 UTC) multi-call binary.\\n\\nUsage: ping [OPTIONS] HOST\\n\\nSend ICMP ECHO_REQUEST packets to network hosts\\n\\n\\t-4,-6\\t\\tForce IP or IPv6 name resolution\\n\\t-c CNT\\t\\tSend only CNT pings\\n\\t-s SIZE\\t\\tSend SIZE data bytes in packets (default 56)\\n\\t-A\\t\\tPing as soon as reply is recevied\\n\\t-t TTL\\t\\tSet TTL\\n\\t-I IFACE/IP\\tSource interface or IP address\\n\\t-W SEC\\t\\tSeconds to wait for the first response (default 10)\\n\\t\\t\\t(after all -c CNT packets are sent)\\n\\t-w SEC\\t\\tSeconds until ping exits (default:infinite)\\n\\t\\t\\t(can exit earlier with -c CNT)\\n\\t-q\\t\\tQuiet, only display output at start\\n\\t\\t\\tand when finished\\n\\t-p HEXBYTE\\tPattern to use for payload\\nroot:x:0:0:root:/root:/bin/ash\\nbin:x:1:1:bin:/bin:/sbin/nologin\\ndaemon:x:2:2:daemon:/sbin:/sbin/nologin\\nadm:x:3:4:adm:/var/adm:/sbin/nologin\\nlp:x:4:7:lp:/var/spool/lpd:/sbin/nologin\\nsync:x:5:0:sync:/sbin:/bin/sync\\nshutdown:x:6:0:shutdown:/sbin:/sbin/shutdown\\nhalt:x:7:0:halt:/sbin:/sbin/halt\\nmail:x:8:12:mail:/var/spool/mail:/sbin/nologin\\nnews:x:9:13:news:/usr/lib/news:/sbin/nologin\\nuucp:x:10:14:uucp:/var/spool/uucppublic:/sbin/nologin\\noperator:x:11:0:operator:/root:/bin/sh\\nman:x:13:15:man:/usr/man:/sbin/nologin\\npostmaster:x:14:12:postmaster:/var/spool/mail:/sbin/nologin\\ncron:x:16:16:cron:/var/spool/cron:/sbin/nologin\\nftp:x:21:21::/var/lib/ftp:/sbin/nologin\\nsshd:x:22:22:sshd:/dev/null:/sbin/nologin\\nat:x:25:25:at:/var/spool/cron/atjobs:/sbin/nologin\\nsquid:x:31:31:Squid:/var/cache/squid:/sbin/nologin\\nxfs:x:33:33:X Font Server:/etc/X11/fs:/sbin/nologin\\ngames:x:35:35:games:/usr/games:/sbin/nologin\\npostgres:x:70:70::/var/lib/postgresql:/bin/sh\\ncyrus:x:85:12::/usr/cyrus:/sbin/nologin\\nvpopmail:x:89:89::/var/vpopmail:/sbin/nologin\\nntp:x:123:123:NTP:/var/empty:/sbin/nologin\\nsmmsp:x:209:209:smmsp:/var/spool/mqueue:/sbin/nologin\\nguest:x:405:100:guest:/dev/null:/sbin/nologin\\nnobody:x:65534:65534:nobody:/:/sbin/nologin\\n","isValid":true}'

DAV methods enabled

INFO

Summary

The URL "http://localhost/VulnerableApp/JWTVulnerability/" has the following allowed methods. These include DAV methods and should be disabled: *, ACL, BASELINE_CONTROL, CHECKIN, CHECKOUT, COPY, DEBUG, GET, HEAD, INDEX, INVALID, INVOKE, LABEL, LINK, LOCK, MERGE, MKACTIVITY, MKCOL, MKDIR, MKWORKSPACE, MOVE, NOTIFY, OPTIONS, PATCH, PIN, POLL, POST, PROPFIND, PROPPATCH, REPLY, REPORT, RMDIR, SEARCH, SHOWMETHOD, SPACEJUMP, SUBSCRIBE, SUBSCRIPTIONS, TEXTSEARCH, TRACK, UNCHECKOUT, UNLINK, UNLOCK, UNSUBSCRIBE, VERSION_CONTROL. This information was found in the requests with ids 1589, 1712, 1743, 1789, 1795, 1798, 1845, 1882, 1898, 1937, 1985, 2025, 2082, 2096, 2150, 2171, 2200, 2221, 2252, 2294, 2344, 2372, 2382, 2399, 2410, 2437, 2472 to 2473, 2500, 2527, 2563, 2595, 2609, 2617, 2627, 2644, 2648, 2675, 2681, 2709, 2743, 2812, 2817, 2829 and 2838.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/VulnerableApp/JWTVulnerability/

DAV methods enabled

INFO

Summary

The URL "http://localhost/VulnerableApp/PersistentXSSInHTMLTagVulnerability/" has the following allowed methods. These include DAV methods and should be disabled: *, ACL, BASELINE_CONTROL, CHECKIN, CHECKOUT, COPY, DEBUG, GET, HEAD, INDEX, INVALID, INVOKE, LABEL, LINK, LOCK, MERGE, MKACTIVITY, MKCOL, MKDIR, MKWORKSPACE, MOVE, NOTIFY, OPTIONS, PATCH, PIN, POLL, POST, PROPFIND, PROPPATCH, REPLY, REPORT, RMDIR, SEARCH, SHOWMETHOD, SPACEJUMP, SUBSCRIBE, SUBSCRIPTIONS, TEXTSEARCH, TRACK, UNCHECKOUT, UNLINK, UNLOCK, UNSUBSCRIBE, VERSION_CONTROL. This information was found in the requests with ids 1751, 1884, 1896, 1931, 1980, 2004, 2052, 2084, 2135, 2159, 2184, 2204, 2235, 2272, 2305, 2333, 2366, 2371, 2381, 2392, 2401, 2412, 2432, 2457, 2493, 2512, 2549 to 2550, 2594, 2608, 2619, 2632, 2661, 2682, 2726, 2752, 2765, 2774, 2788, 2850, 2857, 2868, 2874, 2882 and 2906.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/VulnerableApp/PersistentXSSInHTMLTagVulnerability/

SQL injection

HIGH

Summary

SQL injection in a Unknown database was found at: "http://localhost/VulnerableApp/CommandInjection/LEVEL_2", using HTTP method GET. The sent data was: "ipaddress=1%272%223" The modified parameter was "ipaddress". This vulnerability was found in the request with id 2984.


Description

Due to the requirement for dynamic content of today's web applications, many rely on a database backend to store data that will be called upon and processed by the web application (or other programs). Web applications retrieve data from the database by using Structured Query Language (SQL) queries.

To meet demands of many developers, database servers (such as MSSQL, MySQL, Oracle etc.) have additional built-in functionality that can allow extensive control of the database and interaction with the host operating system itself. An SQL injection occurs when a value originating from the client's request is used within a SQL query without prior sanitisation. This could allow cyber-criminals to execute arbitrary SQL code and steal data or use the additional functionality of the database server to take control of more server components.

The successful exploitation of a SQL injection can be devastating to an organisation and is one of the most commonly exploited web application vulnerabilities.

This injection was detected as the tool was able to cause the server to respond to the request with a database related error.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/VulnerableApp/CommandInjection/LEVEL_2
  • Vulnerable Parameter: ipaddress

Fix

The only proven method to prevent against SQL injection attacks while still maintaining full application functionality is to use parameterized queries (also known as prepared statements). When utilising this method of querying the database, any value supplied by the client will be handled as a string value rather than part of the SQL query.

Additionally, when utilising parameterized queries, the database engine will automatically check to make sure the string being used matches that of the column. For example, the database engine will check that the user supplied input is an integer if the database column is configured to contain integers.

References

  • SecuriTeam
  • Wikipedia
  • OWASP
  • WASC
  • W3 Schools
  • UnixWiz

HTTP proof

GET http://localhost/VulnerableApp/CommandInjection/LEVEL_2?ipaddress=1%272%223 HTTP/1.1
User-agent: python-requests/2.31.0
Host: localhost
Accept-encoding: gzip, deflate
Accept: */*
Connection: keep-alive
b'HTTP/1.1 200 \r\nServer: openresty/1.21.4.3\r\nDate: Wed, 20 Mar 2024 19:24:45 GMT\r\nContent-Type: application/json\r\nTransfer-Encoding: chunked\r\nConnection: keep-alive\r\n'
b'{"content":"sh: syntax error: unterminated quoted string\\n","isValid":true}'

DAV methods enabled

INFO

Summary

The URL "http://localhost/VulnerableApp/PathTraversal/" has the following allowed methods. These include DAV methods and should be disabled: *, ACL, BASELINE_CONTROL, CHECKIN, CHECKOUT, COPY, DEBUG, GET, HEAD, INDEX, INVALID, INVOKE, LABEL, LINK, LOCK, MERGE, MKACTIVITY, MKCOL, MKDIR, MKWORKSPACE, MOVE, NOTIFY, OPTIONS, PATCH, PIN, POLL, POST, PROPFIND, PROPPATCH, REPLY, REPORT, RMDIR, SEARCH, SHOWMETHOD, SPACEJUMP, SUBSCRIBE, SUBSCRIPTIONS, TEXTSEARCH, TRACK, UNCHECKOUT, UNLINK, UNLOCK, UNSUBSCRIBE, VERSION_CONTROL. This information was found in the requests with ids 2059, 2138, 2172, 2236, 2288, 2329, 2340, 2363, 2377, 2383, 2394, 2411, 2438, 2463, 2501, 2522, 2555, 2584, 2605, 2616, 2628, 2643, 2665, 2683, 2710, 2760, 2814, 2819, 2849, 2858, 2872, 2875, 2883, 2892, 2908, 2917, 2935, 2944, 2960, 2977, 2990, 3004, 3012, 3046 and 3058.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/VulnerableApp/PathTraversal/

DAV methods enabled

INFO

Summary

The URL "http://localhost/VulnerableApp/UnrestrictedFileUpload/" has the following allowed methods. These include DAV methods and should be disabled: *, ACL, BASELINE_CONTROL, CHECKIN, CHECKOUT, COPY, DEBUG, GET, HEAD, INDEX, INVALID, INVOKE, LABEL, LINK, LOCK, MERGE, MKACTIVITY, MKCOL, MKDIR, MKWORKSPACE, MOVE, NOTIFY, OPTIONS, PATCH, PIN, POLL, POST, PROPFIND, PROPPATCH, REPLY, REPORT, RMDIR, SEARCH, SHOWMETHOD, SPACEJUMP, SUBSCRIBE, SUBSCRIPTIONS, TEXTSEARCH, TRACK, UNCHECKOUT, UNLINK, UNLOCK, UNSUBSCRIBE, VERSION_CONTROL. This information was found in the requests with ids 2328, 2370, 2384, 2395, 2414, 2426, 2465, 2498, 2533, 2558, 2577, 2602, 2614, 2623, 2633, 2660, 2686, 2708, 2735, 2763, 2807, 2830, 2853, 2865, 2877, 2886, 2904, 2910, 2922, 2952, 2974, 2991, 2996, 3013, 3041, 3061, 3089, 3100, 3125, 3151, 3176, 3196, 3200, 3212 and 3232.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/VulnerableApp/UnrestrictedFileUpload/

OS commanding vulnerability

HIGH

Summary

OS Commanding was found at: "http://localhost/VulnerableApp/CommandInjection/LEVEL_3", using HTTP method GET. The sent data was: "ipaddress=%7C%2Fbin%2Fcat%20%2Fetc%2Fpasswd" The modified parameter was "ipaddress". This vulnerability was found in the request with id 3275.


Description

To perform specific actions from within a web application, it is occasionally required to run Operating System commands and have the output of these commands captured by the web application and returned to the client.

OS command injection occurs when user supplied input is inserted into one of these commands without proper sanitisation and is then executed by the server.

Cyber-criminals will abuse this weakness to perform their own arbitrary commands on the server. This can include everything from simple ping commands to map the internal network, to obtaining full control of the server.

It was possible to inject and verify the execution of specific Operating System commands which indicates that proper input sanitisation is not occurring.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/VulnerableApp/CommandInjection/LEVEL_3
  • Vulnerable Parameter: ipaddress

Fix

It is recommended that untrusted data is never used to form a command to be executed by the OS.

To validate data, the application should ensure that the supplied value contains only the characters that are required to perform the required action.

For example, where the form field expects an IP address, only numbers and periods should be accepted. Additionally, all control operators (&, &&, |, ||, $, \, #) should be explicitly denied and never accepted as valid input by the server.

References

  • WASC
  • OWASP

HTTP proof

GET http://localhost/VulnerableApp/CommandInjection/LEVEL_3?ipaddress=%7C%2Fbin%2Fcat%20%2Fetc%2Fpasswd HTTP/1.1
User-agent: python-requests/2.31.0
Host: localhost
Accept-encoding: gzip, deflate
Accept: */*
Connection: keep-alive
b'HTTP/1.1 200 \r\nServer: openresty/1.21.4.3\r\nDate: Wed, 20 Mar 2024 19:24:50 GMT\r\nContent-Type: application/json\r\nTransfer-Encoding: chunked\r\nConnection: keep-alive\r\n'
b'{"content":"root:x:0:0:root:/root:/bin/ash\\nbin:x:1:1:bin:/bin:/sbin/nologin\\ndaemon:x:2:2:daemon:/sbin:/sbin/nologin\\nadm:x:3:4:adm:/var/adm:/sbin/nologin\\nlp:x:4:7:lp:/var/spool/lpd:/sbin/nologin\\nsync:x:5:0:sync:/sbin:/bin/sync\\nshutdown:x:6:0:shutdown:/sbin:/sbin/shutdown\\nhalt:x:7:0:halt:/sbin:/sbin/halt\\nmail:x:8:12:mail:/var/spool/mail:/sbin/nologin\\nnews:x:9:13:news:/usr/lib/news:/sbin/nologin\\nuucp:x:10:14:uucp:/var/spool/uucppublic:/sbin/nologin\\noperator:x:11:0:operator:/root:/bin/sh\\nman:x:13:15:man:/usr/man:/sbin/nologin\\npostmaster:x:14:12:postmaster:/var/spool/mail:/sbin/nologin\\ncron:x:16:16:cron:/var/spool/cron:/sbin/nologin\\nftp:x:21:21::/var/lib/ftp:/sbin/nologin\\nsshd:x:22:22:sshd:/dev/null:/sbin/nologin\\nat:x:25:25:at:/var/spool/cron/atjobs:/sbin/nologin\\nsquid:x:31:31:Squid:/var/cache/squid:/sbin/nologin\\nxfs:x:33:33:X Font Server:/etc/X11/fs:/sbin/nologin\\ngames:x:35:35:games:/usr/games:/sbin/nologin\\npostgres:x:70:70::/var/lib/postgresql:/bin/sh\\ncyrus:x:85:12::/usr/cyrus:/sbin/nologin\\nvpopmail:x:89:89::/var/vpopmail:/sbin/nologin\\nntp:x:123:123:NTP:/var/empty:/sbin/nologin\\nsmmsp:x:209:209:smmsp:/var/spool/mqueue:/sbin/nologin\\nguest:x:405:100:guest:/dev/null:/sbin/nologin\\nnobody:x:65534:65534:nobody:/:/sbin/nologin\\nBusyBox v1.29.3 (2019-01-24 07:45:07 UTC) multi-call binary.\\n\\nUsage: ping [OPTIONS] HOST\\n\\nSend ICMP ECHO_REQUEST packets to network hosts\\n\\n\\t-4,-6\\t\\tForce IP or IPv6 name resolution\\n\\t-c CNT\\t\\tSend only CNT pings\\n\\t-s SIZE\\t\\tSend SIZE data bytes in packets (default 56)\\n\\t-A\\t\\tPing as soon as reply is recevied\\n\\t-t TTL\\t\\tSet TTL\\n\\t-I IFACE/IP\\tSource interface or IP address\\n\\t-W SEC\\t\\tSeconds to wait for the first response (default 10)\\n\\t\\t\\t(after all -c CNT packets are sent)\\n\\t-w SEC\\t\\tSeconds until ping exits (default:infinite)\\n\\t\\t\\t(can exit earlier with -c CNT)\\n\\t-q\\t\\tQuiet, only display output at start\\n\\t\\t\\tand when finished\\n\\t-p HEXBYTE\\tPattern to use for payload\\n","isValid":true}'

DAV methods enabled

INFO

Summary

The URL "http://localhost/VulnerableApp/UnionBasedSQLInjectionVulnerability/" has the following allowed methods. These include DAV methods and should be disabled: *, ACL, BASELINE_CONTROL, CHECKIN, CHECKOUT, COPY, DEBUG, GET, HEAD, INDEX, INVALID, INVOKE, LABEL, LINK, LOCK, MERGE, MKACTIVITY, MKCOL, MKDIR, MKWORKSPACE, MOVE, NOTIFY, OPTIONS, PATCH, PIN, POLL, POST, PROPFIND, PROPPATCH, REPLY, REPORT, RMDIR, SEARCH, SHOWMETHOD, SPACEJUMP, SUBSCRIBE, SUBSCRIPTIONS, TEXTSEARCH, TRACK, UNCHECKOUT, UNLINK, UNLOCK, UNSUBSCRIBE, VERSION_CONTROL. This information was found in the requests with ids 2459, 2557, 2588, 2610, 2622, 2635, 2647, 2659, 2684, 2758, 2797, 2828, 2841, 2864, 2873, 2879, 2891, 2907, 2926, 2948, 2959, 2967, 2987, 2999, 3016, 3042, 3056, 3070, 3086, 3096, 3118, 3128, 3143, 3167, 3195, 3216, 3230, 3253, 3280, 3302, 3310, 3321, 3325, 3331 and 3360.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/VulnerableApp/UnionBasedSQLInjectionVulnerability/

DAV methods enabled

INFO

Summary

The URL "http://localhost/VulnerableApp/XSSInImgTagAttribute/" has the following allowed methods. These include DAV methods and should be disabled: *, ACL, BASELINE_CONTROL, CHECKIN, CHECKOUT, COPY, DEBUG, GET, HEAD, INDEX, INVALID, INVOKE, LABEL, LINK, LOCK, MERGE, MKACTIVITY, MKCOL, MKDIR, MKWORKSPACE, MOVE, NOTIFY, OPTIONS, PATCH, PIN, POLL, POST, PROPFIND, PROPPATCH, REPLY, REPORT, RMDIR, SEARCH, SHOWMETHOD, SPACEJUMP, SUBSCRIBE, SUBSCRIPTIONS, TEXTSEARCH, TRACK, UNCHECKOUT, UNLINK, UNLOCK, UNSUBSCRIBE, VERSION_CONTROL. This information was found in the requests with ids 2866, 2903, 2933, 2950, 2978, 2989, 3000, 3044, 3063, 3083, 3110, 3117, 3126, 3141, 3155, 3175, 3190, 3210, 3229, 3282, 3306, 3320, 3336, 3344, 3357, 3390, 3403, 3408, 3425, 3441, 3453, 3461, 3477, 3490, 3500, 3502, 3510, 3521, 3524, 3533, 3543, 3556, 3561, 3571 and 3579.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/VulnerableApp/XSSInImgTagAttribute/

HTTP proof

OPTIONS http://localhost/VulnerableApp/XSSInImgTagAttribute/ HTTP/1.1
User-agent: w4af.net
Accept-encoding: gzip, deflate
Host: localhost
Accept: */*
b'HTTP/1.1 404 \r\nServer: openresty/1.21.4.3\r\nDate: Wed, 20 Mar 2024 19:24:42 GMT\r\nContent-Type: application/json\r\nTransfer-Encoding: chunked\r\nConnection: keep-alive\r\nVary: Origin\r\n'
b'{"timestamp":"2024-03-20T19:24:42.439+00:00","status":404,"error":"Not Found","message":"","path":"/VulnerableApp/XSSInImgTagAttribute/"}'
COPY http://localhost/VulnerableApp/XSSInImgTagAttribute/ HTTP/1.1
User-agent: w4af.net
Accept-encoding: gzip, deflate

DAV methods enabled

INFO

Summary

The URL "http://localhost/VulnerableApp/XXEVulnerability/" has the following allowed methods. These include DAV methods and should be disabled: *, ACL, BASELINE_CONTROL, CHECKIN, CHECKOUT, COPY, DEBUG, GET, HEAD, INDEX, INVALID, INVOKE, LABEL, LINK, LOCK, MERGE, MKACTIVITY, MKCOL, MKDIR, MKWORKSPACE, MOVE, NOTIFY, OPTIONS, PATCH, PIN, POLL, POST, PROPFIND, PROPPATCH, REPLY, REPORT, RMDIR, SEARCH, SHOWMETHOD, SPACEJUMP, SUBSCRIBE, SUBSCRIPTIONS, TEXTSEARCH, TRACK, UNCHECKOUT, UNLINK, UNLOCK, UNSUBSCRIBE, VERSION_CONTROL. This information was found in the requests with ids 3262, 3301, 3319, 3332, 3366, 3371, 3402, 3427, 3447, 3467, 3476, 3492, 3504, 3514, 3520, 3526, 3529, 3539, 3552, 3555, 3563, 3572, 3578, 3588, 3597, 3609, 3634 to 3635, 3651, 3670, 3679, 3685, 3691, 3698, 3712, 3718, 3721, 3727, 3729, 3736, 3741, 3747, 3751, 3755 and 3760.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/VulnerableApp/XXEVulnerability/

DAV methods enabled

INFO

Summary

The URL "http://localhost/VulnerableApp/SSRFVulnerability/" has the following allowed methods. These include DAV methods and should be disabled: *, ACL, BASELINE_CONTROL, CHECKIN, CHECKOUT, COPY, DEBUG, GET, HEAD, INDEX, INVALID, INVOKE, LABEL, LINK, LOCK, MERGE, MKACTIVITY, MKCOL, MKDIR, MKWORKSPACE, MOVE, NOTIFY, OPTIONS, PATCH, PIN, POLL, POST, PROPFIND, PROPPATCH, REPLY, REPORT, RMDIR, SEARCH, SHOWMETHOD, SPACEJUMP, SUBSCRIBE, SUBSCRIPTIONS, TEXTSEARCH, TRACK, UNCHECKOUT, UNLINK, UNLOCK, UNSUBSCRIBE, VERSION_CONTROL. This information was found in the requests with ids 3417, 3463, 3475, 3483, 3499, 3505, 3511, 3518, 3525, 3534, 3542, 3557, 3562, 3570, 3576, 3581, 3584, 3589, 3598, 3604, 3607, 3649, 3668, 3678, 3682, 3694, 3699, 3703, 3706, 3711, 3716, 3724, 3731, 3734, 3744, 3750, 3752, 3759, 3764, 3767, 3773, 3777, 3781, 3788 and 3792.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/VulnerableApp/SSRFVulnerability/

b'{"timestamp":"2024-03-20T19:25:02.839+00:00","status":404,"error":"Not Found","message":"","path":"/VulnerableApp/SSRFVulnerability/"}'

SQL injection

HIGH

Summary

SQL injection in a Unknown database was found at: "http://localhost/VulnerableApp/CommandInjection/LEVEL_3", using HTTP method GET. The sent data was: "ipaddress=1%272%223" The modified parameter was "ipaddress". This vulnerability was found in the request with id 4183.


Description

Due to the requirement for dynamic content of today's web applications, many rely on a database backend to store data that will be called upon and processed by the web application (or other programs). Web applications retrieve data from the database by using Structured Query Language (SQL) queries.

To meet demands of many developers, database servers (such as MSSQL, MySQL, Oracle etc.) have additional built-in functionality that can allow extensive control of the database and interaction with the host operating system itself. An SQL injection occurs when a value originating from the client's request is used within a SQL query without prior sanitisation. This could allow cyber-criminals to execute arbitrary SQL code and steal data or use the additional functionality of the database server to take control of more server components.

The successful exploitation of a SQL injection can be devastating to an organisation and is one of the most commonly exploited web application vulnerabilities.

This injection was detected as the tool was able to cause the server to respond to the request with a database related error.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/VulnerableApp/CommandInjection/LEVEL_3
  • Vulnerable Parameter: ipaddress

Fix

The only proven method to prevent against SQL injection attacks while still maintaining full application functionality is to use parameterized queries (also known as prepared statements). When utilising this method of querying the database, any value supplied by the client will be handled as a string value rather than part of the SQL query.

Additionally, when utilising parameterized queries, the database engine will automatically check to make sure the string being used matches that of the column. For example, the database engine will check that the user supplied input is an integer if the database column is configured to contain integers.

References

  • SecuriTeam
  • Wikipedia
  • OWASP
  • WASC
  • W3 Schools
  • UnixWiz

HTTP proof

GET http://localhost/VulnerableApp/CommandInjection/LEVEL_3?ipaddress=1%272%223 HTTP/1.1
User-agent: python-requests/2.31.0
Host: localhost
Accept-encoding: gzip, deflate
Accept: */*
Connection: keep-alive
b'HTTP/1.1 200 \r\nServer: openresty/1.21.4.3\r\nDate: Wed, 20 Mar 2024 19:25:13 GMT\r\nContent-Type: application/json\r\nTransfer-Encoding: chunked\r\nConnection: keep-alive\r\n'
b'{"content":"sh: syntax error: unterminated quoted string\\n","isValid":true}'

DAV methods enabled

INFO

Summary

The URL "http://localhost/VulnerableApp/images/" has the following allowed methods. These include DAV methods and should be disabled: *, ACL, BASELINE_CONTROL, CHECKIN, CHECKOUT, COPY, DEBUG, GET, HEAD, INDEX, INVALID, INVOKE, LABEL, LINK, LOCK, MERGE, MKACTIVITY, MKCOL, MKDIR, MKWORKSPACE, MOVE, NOTIFY, OPTIONS, PATCH, PIN, POLL, POST, PROPFIND, PROPPATCH, REPLY, REPORT, RMDIR, SEARCH, SHOWMETHOD, SPACEJUMP, SUBSCRIBE, SUBSCRIPTIONS, TEXTSEARCH, TRACK, UNCHECKOUT, UNLINK, UNLOCK, UNSUBSCRIBE, VERSION_CONTROL. This information was found in the requests with ids 3900, 3926, 3935, 3940, 3944, 3949 to 3950, 3956, 3964 to 3965, 3969, 3975, 3983, 3992, 3996, 4001, 4007, 4011, 4017, 4023, 4034, 4041, 4064, 4073, 4077, 4080, 4082, 4087, 4096, 4101, 4104, 4111, 4120, 4126, 4134, 4138, 4146, 4148, 4158, 4166, 4174, 4179, 4187, 4191 and 4199.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/VulnerableApp/images/

DAV methods enabled

INFO

Summary

The URL "http://localhost/VulnerableApp/XSSWithHtmlTagInjection/" has the following allowed methods. These include DAV methods and should be disabled: *, ACL, BASELINE_CONTROL, CHECKIN, CHECKOUT, COPY, DEBUG, GET, HEAD, INDEX, INVALID, INVOKE, LABEL, LINK, LOCK, MERGE, MKACTIVITY, MKCOL, MKDIR, MKWORKSPACE, MOVE, NOTIFY, OPTIONS, PATCH, PIN, POLL, POST, PROPFIND, PROPPATCH, REPLY, REPORT, RMDIR, SEARCH, SHOWMETHOD, SPACEJUMP, SUBSCRIBE, SUBSCRIPTIONS, TEXTSEARCH, TRACK, UNCHECKOUT, UNLINK, UNLOCK, UNSUBSCRIBE, VERSION_CONTROL. This information was found in the requests with ids 3704, 3723, 3733, 3742, 3748, 3757, 3761, 3765, 3770, 3775, 3787, 3793, 3798, 3802, 3808, 3816, 3821, 3825, 3832, 3839, 3846, 3851, 3858, 3873, 3887, 3896, 3906, 3909, 3915, 3920, 3925, 3927, 3936, 3942, 4213, 4215, 4228, 4238, 4246, 4268, 4275, 4287, 4295, 4308 and 4314.

  • Vulnerable URL: http://localhost/VulnerableApp/XSSWithHtmlTagInjection/
